commit.message: Updated README to reflect supported versions
Test on Python 3.6

Added support for DRF 3.9

This adds DRF 3.9 to the Tox environment list.

Remove fast finish from Travis

This is no longer needed now that we don't have 100 different combinations

Added Python 3.5 back to Django 1.8

Not all versions of DRF supported Python 3.5, so these are going down as a different list of envrionments because of that.

Added Python 3.5 for older Django versions

The versions of DRF for these Django versions should also support Python 3.5.

Drop Python 3.3

Not going to fight Tox to make it work on Python 3.3, instead let's just drop it.

This also updates pytest-django to support Python 3.5.

Re-pin Tox 2.9

Looks like having a < in the command messes things up, which sorta makes sense.

Pin Tox to 2.9

Tox 3.0 does not support Python 3.3 but it supports up to Python 3.6.

Switch from TOX_ENV to using tox-travis

tox-travis allows us to not have to manage a tox matrix with 70+ different combinations and instead has us only define the combinations in a single location.
Drop Django 1.7 support
Drop Django 1.6 support

Add Django 2.1 and Python 3.5

This is to test the basic support of this combination. Eventually the test matrix will be expanded out to cover Python 3.5 support in all DRF versions that support it.

Add testing on newer versions of DRF and Django

commit.message: Adjusted documentation for supported versions

Add Travis testing for Django 2.0

Django 2.0 does not support Python 2.7 and Python 3.3, so it is not
tested on those combinations. It's only tested on Python 3.4.

We are now almost at 100 combinations on Travis...

Added Tox testing for Django 2.0

This is only supported by two versions of Django REST framework,
since it's a relatively recent release.
Add Travis testing up to DRF 3.8

Added Tox testing up to DRF 3.8

These two versions only support Django 1.10 and Django 1.11, so
that makes testing a bit easier and reduces the number of new
matrix combinations.

Added Django 1.9, 1.10, 1.11 to Travis testing matrix

At this point the testing matrix is massive, somewhere in the range
of 80 different builds. This should probably get cut down at some
point, but that would likely warrant breaking changes or a stable
version support policy (which doesn't currently appear to exist).

Added Django 1.9, 1.10, 1.11 to Tox matrix

While these supports versions past DRF 3.6, this commit is only adding
matrix support up to 3.6 for now to minimize overall changes.
